supporting_spans: When the emperor returned from the Island of Elba, my brother instantly joined the army, was slightly wounded at Waterloo, and retired with the army beyond the Loire.

I loved my brother tenderly, as I told your excellency, and I resolved not to send the money, but to take it to Faria, since their first acquaintance, had been on all points so rational and logical, so wonderfully sagacious, in fact, that he could not understand how so much wisdom on all points could be allied with madness.
reasoning: Contradiction (temporal): The claim is that Faria was re-arrested and shipped to the Château d'If for life, but the evidence shows that he was disbanded from the army and returned home.

analysis.claim_text: Suspected again in 1815, he was re-arrested and shipped to the Château d’If, this time for life.

sub_claims.text: Re-arrested and shipped to the Château d’If.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (temporal): The claim is that Faria was re-arrested and shipped to the Château d'If for life, but the evidence shows that he was disbanded from the army and returned home.
